I1.name: The Hitman and the Seer
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Aphelios''' has access to an arsenal of 5 ''Moonstone Weapons'', created by his sister '''Alune'''. He equips two weapons at any one time, one as his {{as|main weapon}} and one as his {{as|off-hand}}. Each weapon has a unique [[basic attack]] and passive effect.

'''Aphelios''' begins the game with {{ai|Calibrum|Aphelios}} as his {{as|main weapon}} and {{ai|Severum|Aphelios}} in his {{as|off-hand}}, with {{ai|Gravitum|Aphelios}}, {{ai|Infernum|Aphelios}}, and {{ai|Crescendum|Aphelios}} queued in reserve. The queue order can be rearranged based on weapon usage.

{{sbc|Innate - Moonlight:}} Weapons spawn with 50 ''Moonlight'' for [[ammunition]], which is consumed on basic attacks {{tip|on-attack}} or to cast his {{cci|Q.png|champion ability|abilities}}. Abilities that cause '''Aphelios''' to attack do not cost additional ''Moonlight'' on top of their ability cost. Once his {{as|main weapon}} is exhausted of ''Moonlight'', it is moved to the end of the queue and '''Aphelios''' assembles his next available weapon over 1 second to equip it from his reserve, with its [[File:Q.png|20px]] [[champion ability|ability]] being placed on a {{fd|1.5}}-second {{sti|cooldown}} before that time. '''Aphelios''' cannot cast {{ai|Phase|Aphelios}} during the assembly.

{{sbc|Innate - Weapon Master:}} '''Aphelios''' cannot improve his abilities with [[Experience (champion)|skill points]]. He starts the game with {{ai|Phase|Aphelios}} and gains access to {{cci|Q.png|champion ability|abilities}} at level 2 and {{ai|Moonlight Vigil|Aphelios}} at level 6, with the latter improving automatically at levels 11 and 16. Instead, '''Aphelios''' may spend his skill points to gain {{as|{{sti|'''bonus''' attack damage}}}}, {{as|{{sti|'''bonus''' attack speed}}}} or {{sti|{{as|lethality}}}}.
I1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Aphelios has access to an arsenal of 5 Moonstone Weapons, created by his sister Alune. He equips two weapons at any one time, one as his main weapon and one as his off-hand. Each weapon has a unique basic attack and passive effect.
Aphelios begins the game with Aphelios's Calibrum as his main weapon and Aphelios's Severum in his off-hand, with Aphelios's Gravitum, Aphelios's Infernum, and Aphelios's Crescendum queued in reserve. The queue order can be rearranged based on weapon usage.
Innate - Moonlight: Weapons spawn with 50 Moonlight for ammunition, which is consumed on basic attacks on-attack or to cast his Unknown value: cci / Q.png / champion ability / abilities. Abilities that cause Aphelios to attack do not cost additional Moonlight on top of their ability cost. Once his main weapon is exhausted of Moonlight, it is moved to the end of the queue and Aphelios assembles his next available weapon over 1 second to equip it from his reserve, with its File:Q.png champion ability being placed on a 1.5-second cooldown before that time. Aphelios cannot cast Aphelios's Phase during the assembly.
Innate - Weapon Master: Aphelios cannot improve his abilities with Experience (champion). He starts the game with Aphelios's Phase and gains access to Unknown value: cci / Q.png / champion ability / abilities at level 2 and Aphelios's Moonlight Vigil at level 6, with the latter improving automatically at levels 11 and 16. Instead, Aphelios may spend his skill points to gain bonus attack damage, bonus attack speed or lethality.
I1.notes:
* The [[Experience_(champion)|level up]] for the bonus [[attack damage]], [[attack speed]], and [[armor penetration]] have hotkeys Q, W, E, respectively.
** Assigning points '''does not''' follow the same rules as conventional point expenditure. The quickest you can get an individual statistic to rank-6 is by assigning points at {{ap|1|2|3|5|7|9}}.
* An ammunition counter will appear to the right side of the screen at 10 or less ''Moonlight''.
* Abilities can still be used with less than the required amount of ''Moonlight'', consuming all remaining ''Moonlight'' in the process.
*{{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}} does not consume additional ''Moonlight'' for his basic attacks.
* The icon for this ability changes based on the active skin and functions as '''Alune's''' portrait, similarly to '''Aphelios'''' portrait.

I2.name: Calibrum
description: '''Aphelios''' gains {{sti|range|100 '''bonus''' attack range}} while '''Calibrum''' is his {{as|main weapon}}. Enemies damaged by '''Calibrum''' via an ability are ''marked'' for {{fd|4.5}} seconds, {{tip|standard sight|revealing}} them for the duration. '''Aphelios' ''' next basic attack against a ''marked'' target uses the current {{as|off-hand}} weapon and has {{sti|range|1800 range}}, '''bonus''' missile speed, and a brief cast time that lasts shorter based on '''Aphelios' ''' proximity to the target.

This attack will consume the marks from all targets, dealing {{as|15|physical damage}} {{as|(+ 20% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} to the main target for each mark consumed. If '''Calibrum''' is the current {{as|off-hand}} weapon, the empowered attack uses the {{as|main weapon}} instead.
I2.descriptionHtml:
Aphelios gains 100 bonus attack range while Calibrum is his main weapon. Enemies damaged by Calibrum via an ability are marked for 4.5 seconds, revealing them for the duration. Aphelios' next basic attack against a marked target uses the current off-hand weapon and has 1800 range, bonus missile speed, and a brief cast time that lasts shorter based on Aphelios' proximity to the target.
This attack will consume the marks from all targets, dealing 15 (+ 20% bonus AD) bonus physical damage to the main target for each mark consumed. If Calibrum is the current off-hand weapon, the empowered attack uses the main weapon instead.
I2.notes:
* {{ais|Crescendum|Aphelios}} outgoing basic attack can bypass {{cai|W|Yasuo}} and {{cai|E|Braum}} but cannot while returning.
* Triggered ''Marks'' apply on-hit effects, stack {{nie|Energized}} and trigger {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}}, but no other [[on-attack effects]].
* The mark will not be triggered by {{ai|Onslaught|Aphelios}} attacks.
* The increased basic attack range is drawn for '''Aphelios''' to differentiate it from his normal attack range.
* The empowered range for the mark will also be drawn as an indicator for '''Aphelios'''.
* {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}} bolts will use '''Calibrum's''' projectiles for '''Aphelios's''' attacks with '''Calibrum'''.
* If the target becomes {{tip|untargetable}}, {{tip|death|dies}}, or is too far away or no longer in {{tip|sight}} during the empowered attack's cast time, it will still fire despite the target being invalid.{{bug}}
[[File:Calibrum Attack Range screenshot.png|thumb|left|250px|A blue circle outlining the range in which he may perform basic attacks.]]
[[File:Aphelios Calibrum Enhanced Mark Range.png|thumb|left|This glowing indicator will align directly behind each ''marked'' target.]]

I3.name: Severum
description: Basic attacks with '''Severum''' are {{tip|projectile|non-projectile}} and have an {{tip|uncancellable windup}}. '''Severum's''' attacks {{tip|heal}} '''Aphelios''' for {{pp|key=%|2.5 to 9}} of the {{tt|post-mitigation damage|Damage calculated after modifiers}} dealt, increased to {{pp|7.5 to 27|key=%}} for attacks from abilities.

Healing from '''Severum''' in excess of '''Aphelios' ''' {{as|{{sti|'''maximum''' health}}}} is converted into a {{tip|shield}} for an amount of up to {{pp|10;20 to 140 for 13|1;6 to 18}} {{as|(+ 6% '''maximum''' health)}}, lingering for up to 30 seconds.
I3.descriptionHtml:
Basic attacks with Severum are non-projectile and have an uncancellable windup. Severum's attacks heal Aphelios for 2.5% − 9% (based on level) of the post-mitigation damage dealt, increased to 7.5% − 27% (based on level) for attacks from abilities.
Healing from Severum in excess of Aphelios' maximum health is converted into a shield for an amount of up to 1;6 to 18 ‒ undefined (+ 6% maximum health), lingering for up to 30 seconds.
I3.notes: * {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}} bolts will use '''Severum's''' attack animation instead of firing projectiles for '''Aphelios' ''' attacks with '''Severum'''.

I4.name: Gravitum
description: Attacks with '''Gravitum''' {{tip|slow}} enemies by 30% for {{fd|3.5}} seconds, decaying to 10% after {{fd|0.7}} seconds.
I4.descriptionHtml: Attacks with Gravitum slow enemies by 30% for 3.5 seconds, decaying to 10% after 0.7 seconds.
I4.notes:
* ''Gravitum's'' debuff applies even if the target is immune to {{tip|slow|slows}} (via {{tip|slow-immune|slow immunity}} or {{tip|cc-immune|cc-immunity}}).
** The target will be affected after losing their immunity.
* {{iis|Runaan's Hurricane}} bolts will use ''Gravitum's'' projectiles when '''Aphelios''' attacks with ''Gravitum''.

I5.name: Infernum
description: '''Infernum''' shoots a firebolt at the target enemy unit, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to enemies it passes through. Upon reaching the primary target, the firebolt splits into a cone of 4 missiles behind it that deals {{as|physical damage}} to enemies hit. The firebolt deals {{as|110% AD}} {{as|physical damage}} to the primary target and {{as|{{pp|key=%|110*0.75 to 110 for 2|1 to 9}} AD}} {{as|physical damage}} to secondary targets, reduced to {{as|{{pp|key=%|110*0.23 to 110*0.3 for 2|1 to 9}} AD}} {{as|physical damage}} against {{tip|minions}}.
{{tip|critical strike|Critical strikes}} also apply to damage against secondary targets and spray 6 missiles in a 50% wider cone that deals {{sti|{{as|critical damage}}}}.
I5.descriptionHtml:
Infernum shoots a firebolt at the target enemy unit, dealing physical damage to enemies it passes through. Upon reaching the primary target, the firebolt splits into a cone of 4 missiles behind it that deals physical damage to enemies hit. The firebolt deals 110% AD physical damage to the primary target and 1 to 9 ‒ undefined AD physical damage to secondary targets, reduced to 1 to 9 ‒ undefined AD physical damage against minions.
Critical strikes also apply to damage against secondary targets and spray 6 missiles in a 50% wider cone that deals critical damage.
I5.notes:
* ''Infernum's'' attack hit can be {{tip|dodge|dodged}} by or {{tip|blind|missed}} against the primary target. 
** This will not prevent the missile from dealing damage to secondary targets nor from splashing against additional targets behind the primary target. The damage cannot be dodged as or missed against a secondary target.
* {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}} bolts will use ''Infernum's'' projectiles when '''Aphelios''' attacks with ''Infernum''.
** The bolts' attacks shoot 3 missiles, increased to 5 missiles when they {{tip|critically strike}}.

I6.name: Crescendum
description: Basic attacks with '''Crescendum''' hurl the blade at the target, which lingers for {{fd|0.25}} seconds before homing back to '''Aphelios'''. He is unable to declare basic attacks until he retrieves '''Crescendum''', but the attack timer is reset {{tt|once caught|This does not persist when swapping weapons.}}.

Whenever '''Aphelios''' casts an ability that would require him to throw '''Crescendum''', he instead throws a spectral ''Chakram'' at the target that similarly returns to him. '''Aphelios''' accumulates the ''Chakrams'' he catches, up to 20, which last for 5 seconds or until '''Crescendum''' is out of ''Moonlight''. Attacks against {{tip|champions}} will refresh the lifespan on ''Chakrams''.

Basic attacks with '''Crescendum''' are empowered to deal {{as|{{pp|0;then + 15; then + 13.5; then + 12; then + 10.5; then + 9; then + 7.5; then + 6; then + 5*x|0 to 20 by 1|type=number of Chakrams|key=%|formula=Each Chakram grants less bonus damage than the last, starting at 15% and diminishing to 5% for 10+ Chakrams.}} AD}} {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} and have a {{ap|0.16/1.5*100|round=2}}% ''{{tip|attack windup|wind up}}'' percentage, decreased to {{ap|0.1/1.5*100|round=2}}% when {{tip|critically strike|critically striking}}. The bonus damage from ''Chakrams'' can ''critically strike''.
I6.descriptionHtml:
Basic attacks with Crescendum hurl the blade at the target, which lingers for 0.25 seconds before homing back to Aphelios. He is unable to declare basic attacks until he retrieves Crescendum, but the attack timer is reset once caught.
Whenever Aphelios casts an ability that would require him to throw Crescendum, he instead throws a spectral Chakram at the target that similarly returns to him. Aphelios accumulates the Chakrams he catches, up to 20, which last for 5 seconds or until Crescendum is out of Moonlight. Attacks against champions will refresh the lifespan on Chakrams.
Basic attacks with Crescendum are empowered to deal 0 to 20 by 1 ‒ undefined AD bonus physical damage and have a % wind up percentage, decreased to % when critically striking. The bonus damage from Chakrams can critically strike.
I6.notes:
* Accumulated ''Chakrams'' accompany '''Crescendum''' whenever '''Aphelios''' performs a basic attack. This is merely a visual representation of the increased damage, and the separate blades are not considered separate damage sources nor {{tip|projectile|projectiles}}.
* All ''Chakram'' stacks are lost if the '''Crescendum''' projectile is destroyed (i.e {{ai|W|Yasuo}}, {{ai|E|Braum}}).
* At high attack speeds '''Crescendum''' will lower '''Aphelios'''' total attack speed, even when right next to his target.

Q1.name: Weapons of the Faithful
description: The active effect of '''Aphelios'''' [[File:Q.png|20px]] varies based on his current {{as|main weapon}}.
The individual actives do not share a cooldown.
Q1.descriptionHtml:
The active effect of Aphelios' File:Q.png varies based on his current main weapon.
The individual actives do not share a cooldown.

Q2.name: Moonshot
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Aphelios''' fires a bolt of energy in the target direction that deals {{as|{{pp|60 to 160 for 7|1 to 13 for 7}}|physical damage}} {{as|(+ {{pp|42 to 60 for 7|1 to 13 for 7|key=%}} '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ 100% AP)}} {{as|physical damage}} to the first enemy hit.
Q2.descriptionHtml: Active: Aphelios fires a bolt of energy in the target direction that deals 1 to 13 for 7 ‒ undefined (+ 1 to 13 for 7 ‒ undefined bonus AD) (+ 100% AP) physical damage to the first enemy hit.

Q3.name: Onslaught
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Aphelios''' enters an onslaught for {{fd|1.75}} seconds, gaining {{as|20%|ms}} {{as|(+ 10% per 100 AP)}} {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} and autonomously performing up to 6 {{as|(+ 2 per 100% '''bonus''' attack speed)|attack speed}} attacks over the duration against the nearest {{tip|sight|visible}} enemy, prioritizing enemy {{tip|champions}}.

Attacks alternate between ''Severum'' and his current {{as|off-hand}} weapon, each dealing 25% {{tip|on-hit}} damage and {{as|{{pp|10 to 40 for 7|1 to 13}}|physical damage}} {{as|(+ {{pp|20 to 35 for 7|1 to 13|key=%}} '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|physical damage}}, affected by {{tip|critical strike}} modifiers.

'''Aphelios''' cannot cast ''{{ai|Phase|Aphelios}}'' nor ''{{ai|Moonlight Vigil|Aphelios}}'' during ''Onslaught'', but he is still able to move. He cannot perform attacks while unable to declare basic attacks.
Q3.descriptionHtml:
Active: Aphelios enters an onslaught for 1.75 seconds, gaining 20% (+ 10% per 100 AP) bonus movement speed and autonomously performing up to 6 (+ 2 per 100% bonus attack speed) attacks over the duration against the nearest visible enemy, prioritizing enemy champions.
Attacks alternate between Severum and his current off-hand weapon, each dealing 25% on-hit damage and 1 to 13 ‒ undefined (+ 1 to 13 ‒ undefined bonus AD) physical damage, affected by critical strike modifiers.
Aphelios cannot cast Aphelios's Phase nor Aphelios's Moonlight Vigil during Onslaught, but he is still able to move. He cannot perform attacks while unable to declare basic attacks.

Q4.name: Binding Eclipse
description: {{sbc|{{ai|Gravitum|Aphelios}} - Active:}} '''Aphelios''' expunges all enemies with ''Gravitum's'' {{tip|slow}} debuff, dealing {{as|{{pp|50 to 110 for 7|1 to 13}}|magic damage}} {{as|(+ {{pp|26 to 35 for 7|1 to 13|key=%}} '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ 70% AP)}} {{as|magic damage}} and {{tip|root|rooting}} them for 1 second.
''Binding Eclipse'' also empowers in-flight ''Gravitum'' projectiles to instantly affect their targets upon hitting them.
Q4.descriptionHtml:
Aphelios's Gravitum - Active: Aphelios expunges all enemies with Gravitum's slow debuff, dealing 1 to 13 ‒ undefined (+ 1 to 13 ‒ undefined bonus AD) (+ 70% AP) magic damage and rooting them for 1 second.
Binding Eclipse also empowers in-flight Gravitum projectiles to instantly affect their targets upon hitting them.
Q4.notes:
* No compensations are made if ''Binding Eclipse'' is used to empower in-flight ''Gravitum'' projectiles that are {{tip|homing projectile destruction|destroyed}} or parried, wasting the effect in the process.
* ''Binding Eclipse'' cannot expunge enemies affected by ''Gravitum'' that are {{tip|untargetable}}.
* ''Binding Eclipse'' cannot be cast without a marked target.

Q5.name: Duskwave
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Aphelios''' unleashes a wave of energy in a cone in the target direction, dealing {{as|{{pp|25 to 65 for 7|1 to 13}}|physical damage}} {{as|(+ {{pp|56 to 80 for 7|1 to 13|key=%}} '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ 70% AP)}} {{as|physical damage}} to all enemies hit and locking on to each of them. After {{fd|0.25}} seconds, '''Aphelios''' then fires a volley of attacks from his current {{as|off-hand}} weapon, dealing {{as|100% AD}} {{as|physical damage}} and applying {{tip|on-hit}} effects at 100% effectiveness to each locked-on enemy. The damage is affected by {{tip|critical strike}} modifiers. There is no {{sti|range}} limit for locked-on targets.
Q5.descriptionHtml: Active: Aphelios unleashes a wave of energy in a cone in the target direction, dealing 1 to 13 ‒ undefined (+ 1 to 13 ‒ undefined bonus AD) (+ 70% AP) physical damage to all enemies hit and locking on to each of them. After 0.25 seconds, Aphelios then fires a volley of attacks from his current off-hand weapon, dealing 100% AD physical damage and applying on-hit effects at 100% effectiveness to each locked-on enemy. The damage is affected by critical strike modifiers. There is no range limit for locked-on targets.

Q6.name: Sentry
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Aphelios''' deploys an {{tip|untargetable}} lunar sentry at the target location that arms after {{fd|0.35}} seconds, lasting for up to 20 seconds and granting {{tip|sight}} of its surroundings. The sentry attacks if an enemy gets in range, reducing its duration to 4 seconds and becoming targetable. Sentries have {{as|6 health}} and take 3 damage per {{tip|ranged}} basic attack and 4 damage per hit by abilities. {{tip|Turret}} attacks kill sentries instantly.

The sentry autonomously attacks the nearest {{tip|sight|visible}} enemy in range with a clone of '''Aphelios''' current {{as|off-hand}} weapon at {{as|{{fd|0.8}} attack speed|attack speed}}, dealing {{as|{{pp|31 to 100 for 7|1 to 13}}|physical damage}} {{as|(+ {{pp|40 to 60 for 7|1 to 13|key=%}} '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ 50% AP)}} {{as|physical damage}}. The sentry can {{tip|critically strike}} and benefits from '''Aphelios'''' {{sti|attack speed|{{as|attack speed}}}} and {{sti|critical chance|{{as|critical strike chance}}}}.
''See [[Aphelios/LoL#Pets|Pets]] for more details about the sentry. Sentry will cast at max range if cast beyond that.''
Q6.descriptionHtml:
Active: Aphelios deploys an untargetable lunar sentry at the target location that arms after 0.35 seconds, lasting for up to 20 seconds and granting sight of its surroundings. The sentry attacks if an enemy gets in range, reducing its duration to 4 seconds and becoming targetable. Sentries have 6 health and take 3 damage per ranged basic attack and 4 damage per hit by abilities. Turret attacks kill sentries instantly.
The sentry autonomously attacks the nearest visible enemy in range with a clone of Aphelios current off-hand weapon at 0.8 attack speed, dealing 1 to 13 ‒ undefined (+ 1 to 13 ‒ undefined bonus AD) (+ 50% AP) physical damage. The sentry can critically strike and benefits from Aphelios' attack speed and critical strike chance.
See Aphelios/LoL#Pets for more details about the sentry. Sentry will cast at max range if cast beyond that.

W.name: Phase
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Aphelios''' switches between his {{as|main weapon}} and {{as|off-hand}} weapon over {{fd|0.25}} seconds.
W.descriptionHtml: Active: Aphelios switches between his main weapon and off-hand weapon over 0.25 seconds.
W.notes: * Switching does not interrupt '''any''' commands '''Aphelios''' was issued before or during ''Phase''.

E.name: Weapon Queue System
description: The icon of this ability reflects the next weapon that is in reserve.
{{sbc|Active:}} '''Aphelios''' receives a text prompt of the weapon '''Alune''' will create next.
E.descriptionHtml:
The icon of this ability reflects the next weapon that is in reserve.
Active: Aphelios receives a text prompt of the weapon Alune will create next.
E.notes: * This ability also includes the icon of the {{as|off-hand}}.

R.name: Moonlight Vigil
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Aphelios''' casts forth a lunar spotlight in the target direction that briefly grants {{tip|sight}} of the area along its path and stops upon illuminating an enemy {{tip|champion|champion}}. '''Alune''' smites the area centered on the illuminated target, dealing {{as|{{pp|125 to 225 for 3|6 to 16}}|physical damage}} {{as|(+ 20% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ 100% AP)}} {{as|physical damage}} to enemy champions struck and locking-on to each target hit, as well as granting {{tip|sight}} of the area for 2 seconds.

After {{fd|0.3}} seconds of the illumination, attacks will begin raining from the sky based on '''Aphelios' ''' current {{as|main weapon}}, dealing {{as|100% AD}} {{as|physical damage}} and applying {{tip|on-hit}} effects at 100% effectiveness upon each target locked-on by ''Moonlight Vigil''. These attacks can {{tip|critically strike}} for {{as|{{critical damage|20|100}} AD}} {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}. There is no {{sti|range}} limit for locked-on targets.
{{lc|{{ai|Calibrum|Aphelios}}}} Applies an empowered mark that deals {{as|{{pp|50 to 110 for 3|6 to 16}} {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}}} per ''mark''.
{{lc|{{ai|Severum|Aphelios}}}} If at least one enemy champion is hit, '''Aphelios''' {{tip|heals}} for {{pp|250 to 450 for 3|6 to 16}}.
{{lc|{{ai|Gravitum|Aphelios}}}} The initial {{tip|slow}} is increased to 99% and ''{{ai|Binding Eclipse|Aphelios}}'' will {{tip|root}} for {{fd|1.35}} seconds instead.
{{lc|{{ai|Infernum|Aphelios}}}} The initial blast deals {{as|{{pp|50 to 150 for 3|6 to 16}}|physical damage}} {{as|(+ 25% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}. Attacks {{tip|splash damage|splash}} in a 400 unit circle instead of a cone, dealing{{ft|90% of that damage.|{{as|{{pp|50*0.9 to 150*0.9 for 3|6 to 16}}|physical damage}} {{as|(+ {{ap|25*0.9}}% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|physical damage}}.}}Enemy champions will take damage from overlapping areas.
{{lc|{{ai|Crescendum|Aphelios}}}} 5 additional spectral chakrams return to '''Aphelios''' from the first enemy champion hit, for a total of 6, on top of those from other enemies hit.
R.descriptionHtml:
Active: Aphelios casts forth a lunar spotlight in the target direction that briefly grants sight of the area along its path and stops upon illuminating an enemy champion. Alune smites the area centered on the illuminated target, dealing 6 to 16 ‒ undefined (+ 20% bonus AD) (+ 100% AP) physical damage to enemy champions struck and locking-on to each target hit, as well as granting sight of the area for 2 seconds.
After 0.3 seconds of the illumination, attacks will begin raining from the sky based on Aphelios' current main weapon, dealing 100% AD physical damage and applying on-hit effects at 100% effectiveness upon each target locked-on by Moonlight Vigil. These attacks can critically strike for (+ IE 25%) AD bonus physical damage. There is no range limit for locked-on targets. R.notes:
* The basic attacks always count as {{tip|projectile|projectiles}} unless {{ai|Severum|Aphelios}} is being used. The lunar beam, however, may always be intercepted regardless of which weapon is in play as the main weapon.
* {{tip|Spell shield}} blocks the ''Moonlight Vigil's'' initial detonation damage but does not prevent the attacks from locking-on.
* The basic attacks from ''Moonlight Vigil'' {{tip|critically strike}} independently from each other. Targets further away from the center of the blast are hit after a slightly longer delay. These attacks do not apply [[on-attack effects]].
*Changing weapons while ''Moonlight Vigil'' is in flight does not change the effect it has when it hits.
{{Effect at cast time start}}
* ''Moonlight Vigil's'' effect radius is centered around the location of the missile as it collides.
* With {{ai|Calibrum|Aphelios}}, the extra damage from consuming the mark is a bonus damage on top of ''Calibrum's '' normal mark consumption damage.
* With {{ai|Infernum|Aphelios}}, 14 fire bolts splash from each target hit (18 for {{tip|critical strike|critical strikes}}). This does not occur if the initial damage of ''Moonlight Vigil'' [[kill]]s the target.
* With {{ai|Infernum|Aphelios}},the splash attacks damage is also modified by Infernum attack secondary target damage amplifier, which means it only deals 70.125% (=82.5%*85%) of attack damage to secondary targets before level 9. 
* With {{ai|Crescendum|Aphelios}}, 1 spectral chakram is gained for every target hit by the blast, meaning it is possible to gain up to 10 spectral chakrams with one use of ''Moonlight Vigil'' if it hits 5 enemy champions.
* With {{ai|Severum|Aphelios}}, the extra flat heal is given only once, not per target. However, all damage done by ''Moonlight Vigil'' with it also heals him from ''Severum's '' own passive effect.
* The locked-on attacks' can be {{tip|dodge|dodged}} and {{tip|block|blocked}}, but won't be prevented if '''Aphelios''' is {{tip|blind|blinded}}.
** Preventing the attack also prevents the additional effect (e.g. marking them with {{ai|Gravitum|Aphelios}} or granting {{ai|Crescendum|Aphelios|spectral chakrams}}).
* ''Moonlight Vigil'' has different visual effects changed accordingly to each weapon. ''This may vary depending on the [[skin]], this showcases the '''default''':''
